ComplexImage C only
[Class ComplexImage]

Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 11/24/1999. More...

Defines

#define kC_GetPixelMacroRe(x, y, Image)   ((Image).ppMatrixRe[y][x])
 Macro function for accessing real values in a complex image.

#define kC_GetPixelMacroIm(x, y, Image)   ((Image).ppMatrixIm[y][x])
 Macro function for accessing imaginar values in a complex image.

#define kC_SetPixelMacroRe(x, y, Color, Image)   ((Image).ppMatrixRe[y][x]=Color);
 Macro function for setting real values in a complex image.

#define kC_SetPixelMacroIm(x, y, Color, Image)   ((Image).ppMatrixIm[y][x]=Color);
 Macro function for setting imaginar values in a complex image.


Functions

FLOAT32 kC_GetPixelRe (int x, int y, const TComplexImage *pInfo)
 returns the real pixel value at position (x,y), including range check.

FLOAT32 kC_GetPixelIm (int x, int y, const TComplexImage *pInfo)
 returns the imaginary pixel value at position (x,y), including range check.

FLOAT32 kC_GetPixelFastRe (int x, int y, const TComplexImage *pInfo)
 returns the real pixel value at position (x,y), without range check.

FLOAT32 kC_GetPixelFastIm (int x, int y, const TComplexImage *pInfo)
 returns the imaginary pixel value at position (x,y), without range check.

bool kC_SetPixel (int x, int y, FLOAT32 Re, FLOAT32 Im, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 sets both the real (Re) and imaginary (Im) complex pixel value at position (x,y), including range check, slow acces.

bool kC_SetPixelFast (int x, int y, FLOAT32 Re, FLOAT32 Im, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 sets both the real (Re) and imaginary (Im) complex pixel value at position (x,y), without range check, fast access.

bool kC_SetPixelRe (int x, int y, FLOAT32 Re, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 sets only the real pixel value at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

bool kC_SetPixelIm (int x, int y, FLOAT32 Im, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 sets only the imaginary pixel value at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

bool kC_SetPixelFastRe (int x, int y, FLOAT32 Re, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 sets only the real pixel value at position (x,y), without range check, fast access.

bool kC_SetPixelFastIm (int x, int y, FLOAT32 Im, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 sets only the imaginary pixel value at position (x,y), without range check, fast access.

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 11/24/1999.

Basic ComplexImage functions to be used as stand alone c functions only. The C++ part does not use these functions.

Version:
0.90
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk

Define Documentation

#define kC_GetPixelMacroIm (  x,
y,
Image    )     ((Image).ppMatrixIm[y][x])
 

Macro function for accessing imaginar values in a complex image.

The macro is very fast, but be careful when using the macro, there are no type and range checking. Origo always (0,0).

Parameters:
x  (int) x-position
y  (int) y-position
Image  (TComplexImage) The image to access pixel in.

Definition at line 406 of file c_kernel_functions.h.

Referenced by kC_FlipVertical(), kC_GetPixelFastIm(), kC_GetPixelIm(), kC_Rotate90(), and kC_SetPeriodicBorder().
